result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Scott

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety; Not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription

Defendant Michael J Scott in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Argument on bond. Court sets $1000 cash bond; Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Court appoints Atty Becky Van Dam.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 1/15/2023.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with Atty Van Dam.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
